refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Signals
refsect1.synopsis: "activate" : Run Last "changed" : Run Last "clear-cell" : Run Last "clip-range" : Run Last "deactivate" : Run Last "enter-pressed" : Run Last "entry-focus-in" : Run Last "entry-focus-out" : Run Last "move-cursor" : Run Last / Action "move-range" : Run Last "new-column-width" : Run Last "new-row-height" : Run Last "populate-popup" : Run Last "resize-range" : Run Last "select-column" : Run Last "select-range" : Run Last "select-row" : Run Last "set-cell" : Run Last "set-scroll-adjustments" : Run Last "traverse" : Run Last

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: GtkSheet is a matrix widget for GTK+. It consists of an scrollable grid of cells where you can put text or other GtkWidget's in. Cells are organized in rows (GtkSheetRow) and columns (GtkSheetColumn). Cell contents can be edited interactively through a specially designed entry (GtkItemEntry). A GtkSheet is also a container subclass, allowing you to display buttons, curves, pixmaps and any other widget in it. You can also set many attributes as: border, foreground and background color, text justification, and more. The testgtksheet program shows how easy is to create a spreadsheet-like GUI using this widget set.

refsect2.title: GtkSheet
refsect2.para: The GtkSheet struct contains only private data. It should only be accessed through the functions described below.

refsect2.title: GtkSheetChild
refsect2.para: The GtkSheetChild struct contains only private data. It should only be accessed through the functions described below.

refsect2.title: GtkSheetRow
refsect2.para: The GtkSheetRow struct contains only private data. It should only be accessed through the functions described below.

refsect2.title: GtkSheetCell
refsect2.para: The GtkSheetCell struct contains only private data. It should only be accessed through the functions described below.

refsect2.title: GtkSheetRange
refsect2.para: Defines a rectangular range of cells.

refsect2.title: GtkSheetButton
refsect2.para: The GtkSheetButton struct contains only private data. It should only be accessed through the functions described below.

refsect2.title: GtkSheetCellAttr
refsect2.para: The GtkSheetCellAttr struct contains only private data. It should only be accessed through the functions described below.

refsect2.title: GtkSheetCellBorder
refsect2.para: The GtkSheetCellBorder struct contains only private data. It should only be accessed through the functions described below.

refsect2.title: enum GtkSheetAttrType
refsect2.programlisting: typedef enum { GTK_SHEET_FOREGROUND, GTK_SHEET_BACKGROUND, GTK_SHEET_FONT, GTK_SHEET_JUSTIFICATION, GTK_SHEET_BORDER, GTK_SHEET_BORDER_COLOR, GTK_SHEET_IS_EDITABLE, GTK_SHEET_IS_VISIBLE } GtkSheetAttrType;

refsect2.title: enum GtkSheetState
refsect2.para: Selection state of the GtkSheet

refsect2.title: enum GtkSheetEntryType
refsect2.programlisting: typedef enum { GTK_SHEET_ENTRY_TYPE_DEFAULT, GTK_SHEET_ENTRY_TYPE_GTK_ITEM_ENTRY, GTK_SHEET_ENTRY_TYPE_GTK_ENTRY, GTK_SHEET_ENTRY_TYPE_GTK_TEXT_VIEW, GTK_SHEET_ENTRY_TYPE_GTK_DATA_TEXT_VIEW, GTK_SHEET_ENTRY_TYPE_GTK_SPIN_BUTTON, GTK_SHEET_ENTRY_TYPE_GTK_COMBO_BOX, GTK_SHEET_ENTRY_TYPE_GTK_COMBO_BOX_ENTRY, GTK_SHEET_ENTRY_TYPE_GTK_COMBO, } GtkSheetEntryType;
refsect2.para: Subset of GtkEditable Widgets to allow selecting a widget from glade-3

refsect2.title: enum GtkSheetVerticalJustification
refsect2.para: Vertical text alignment.

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_new ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new sheet widget with the given number of rows and columns.

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_construct ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_sheet_construct (GtkSheet *sheet, guint rows, guint columns, const gchar *title);
refsect2.para: Initializes an existent GtkSheet with the given number of rows and columns.

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_new_browser ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new browser sheet. Its cells cannot be edited(read-only).

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_construct_browser ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_sheet_construct_browser (GtkSheet *sheet, guint rows, guint columns, const gchar *title);
refsect2.para: Initializes an existent read-only GtkSheet with the given number of rows and columns.

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_new_with_custom_entry ()
refsect2.programlisting: GtkWidget * gtk_sheet_new_with_custom_entry (guint rows, guint columns, const gchar *title, GType entry_type);
refsect2.para: Creates a new sheet widget with the given number of rows and columns and a custome entry type.

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_construct_with_custom_entry ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_sheet_construct_with_custom_entry (GtkSheet *sheet, guint rows, guint columns, const gchar *title, GType entry_type);
refsect2.para: Initializes an existent read-only GtkSheet with the given number of rows and columns and a custom entry.

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_change_entry ()
refsect2.para: Changes the current entry of the cell in GtkSheet. The old sheet entry widget gets dropped and a new entry widget is created. Beware: You will have to reconnect all your signal handlers after changing an entry.

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_get_entry_type ()
refsect2.para: Get sheets entry type, if known

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_get_entry ()
refsect2.para:
Get sheet's entry widget.
If the entry widget is a container, the direct childs of the container are searched for a valid entry widget. If you want the container itself to be returned, you should use #gtk_sheet_get_entry_widget() instead.

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_get_entry_widget ()
refsect2.para:
Get sheet's entry widget.
If the entry widget is a container, the container widget is returned. In order to get the entry in the container child, you might want to use #gtk_sheet_get_entry() instead.

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_get_entry_text ()
refsect2.para:
Get the text out of the sheet_entry.
This function is mainly used to synchronize the text of a second entry with the sheet_entry.
This function is necessary, because not all possible entry widgets implement the GtkEditable interface yet.

listitem.simpara: a copy of the sheet_entry text or NULL. This function returns an allocated string, so g_free() it after usage!

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_set_entry_text ()
refsect2.para:
Set the text in the sheet_entry (and active cell).
This function is mainly used to synchronize the text of a second entry with the sheet_entry.
This function is necessary, because not all possible entry widgets implement the GtkEditable interface yet.

listitem.simpara: the text to be set or NULL

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_set_entry_editable ()
refsect2.para:
Set the editable flag in the sheet_entry
This function is mainly used to synchronize the editable flag of a second entry with the sheet_entry.
This function is necessary, because not all possible entry widgets implement the GtkEditable interface yet.

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_entry_signal_connect_changed ()
refsect2.para:
Connect a handler to the sheet_entry "changed" signal. The user_data argument of the handler will be filled with the GtkSheet.
This function is mainly used to synchronize a second entry widget with the sheet_entry.
This function is necessary, because not all possible entry widgets implement the GtkEditable interface yet.

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_entry_signal_disconnect_by_func ()
refsect2.para:
Disconnect a handler from the sheet_entry "changed" signal
This function is mainly used to synchronize a second entry widget with the sheet_entry.
This function is necessary, because not all possible entry widgets implement the GtkEditable interface yet.

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_entry_select_region ()
refsect2.para:
Selects a region of text.
This function is necessary, because not all possible entry widgets implement the GtkEditable interface yet.

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_get_state ()
refsect2.para: Get the selection state of the sheet (GtkSheetState).

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_get_attributes ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean gtk_sheet_get_attributes (GtkSheet *sheet, gint row, gint col, GtkSheetCellAttr *attributes);
refsect2.para: Gett cell attributes of the given cell.

listitem.simpara: TRUE means that the cell is currently allocated.

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_get_rows_count ()
refsect2.para: Get the number of the rows of the GtkSheet.

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_get_visible_range ()
refsect2.para: Get sheet's ranges in a GkSheetRange structure.

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_set_selection_mode ()
refsect2.para: Sets the selection mode of the cells in a GtkSheet.

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_autoresize ()
refsect2.para: Gets the autoresize mode of GtkSheet.

listitem.simpara: TRUE if autoresize_columns or autoresize_rows was set, or FALSE if none

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_autoresize_columns ()
refsect2.para: Gets the autoresize mode for GtkSheet columns.

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_set_autoresize_columns ()
refsect2.para: Controls wether columns will be autoresized upon deactivation, as you type text or set a cell_text value. If you want the cells to be autoresized when you pack widgets look at gtk_sheet_attach_*().

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_autoresize_rows ()
refsect2.para: Gets the autoresize mode for GtkSheet rows.

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_set_autoresize_rows ()
refsect2.para: Controls wether rows will be autoresized upon deactivation, as you type text or set a cell_text value. If you want the cells to be autoresized when you pack widgets look at gtk_sheet_attach_*().

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_set_autoresize ()
refsect2.para: Controls wether cells will be autoresized upon deactivation, as you type text or set a cell_text value. If you want the cells to be autoresized when you pack widgets look at gtk_sheet_attach_*(). This function sets both: autoresize_columns and autoresize_cells.

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_autoscroll ()
refsect2.para: Get the autoscroll mode of GtkSheet.

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_set_autoscroll ()
refsect2.para: The sheet will be automatically scrolled when you move beyond the last row/col in GtkSheet.

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_clip_text ()
refsect2.para: Get clip text mode in GtkSheet. When clip text mode is turned off, cell text is written over neighbour columns, as long as their contents are empty.

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_set_clip_text ()
refsect2.para: Clip text in cell. When clip text mode is turned off, cell text is written over neighbour columns, as long as their contents are empty.

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_justify_entry ()
refsect2.para: Get the cell entry editor justification setting from GtkSheet.

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_set_justify_entry ()
refsect2.para: Justify cell entry editor in GtkSheet.

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_get_vjustification ()
refsect2.para: Get the default vertical cell text justification from GtkSheet.

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_set_vjustification ()
refsect2.para: Set the default vertical cell text justification for GtkSheet.

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_locked ()
refsect2.para: Get the lock status of GtkSheet, locked means the sheet is not editable, cell contents cannot be modified by the user.

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_set_locked ()
refsect2.para: Lock the GtkSheet, which means it is no longer editable, cell contents cannot be modified by the user.

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_set_title ()
refsect2.para: Set GtkSheet title. The widget will keep a copy of the string.

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_get_description ()
refsect2.para: Get sheet description.

listitem.simpara: sheet description or NULL, do not modify or free it

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_set_description ()
refsect2.para: Set GtkSheet description for application use.

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_is_frozen ()
refsect2.para: Get freeze status.

listitem.simpara: TRUE or FALSE wether the sheet is frozen

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_freeze ()
refsect2.para: Freeze all visual updates of the GtkSheet. The updates will occure in a more efficient way than if you made them on a unfrozen GtkSheet .

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_thaw ()
refsect2.para: Thaw the sheet after you have made a number of changes on a frozen sheet. The updates will occure in a more efficient way than if you made them on a unfrozen sheet .

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_moveto ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_sheet_moveto (GtkSheet *sheet, gint row, gint column, gint row_align, gint col_align);
refsect2.para:
Scroll the viewing area of the sheet to the given column and row;
row_align and col_align are between 0-1 representing the location the row should appear on the screnn, 0 being top or left, 1 being bottom or right.

passing row_align/col_align of -1 will suppress movement in that direction.
if row or column is negative then there is no change

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_set_background ()
refsect2.para: Sets the background color of the GtkSheet. If pass NULL, the sheet will be reset to the default color.

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_set_grid ()
refsect2.para: Set the grid color. If pass NULL, the grid will be reset to the default color.

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_grid_visible ()
refsect2.para: Gets the visibility of grid in GtkSheet.

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_show_grid ()
refsect2.para: Sets the visibility of grid in GtkSheet.

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_get_hadjustment ()
refsect2.para: Get horizontal scroll adjustments.

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_set_hadjustment ()
refsect2.para: Change horizontal scroll adjustments.

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_get_vadjustment ()
refsect2.para: Get vertical scroll adjustments.

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_set_vadjustment ()
refsect2.para: Change vertical scroll adjustments.

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_in_clip ()
refsect2.para: Get the clip status of GtkSheet.

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_clip_range ()
refsect2.para: Save selected range to "clipboard".

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_unclip_range ()
refsect2.para: Free clipboard.

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_get_active_cell ()
refsect2.para: Store the coordinates of the active cell in row,col. If (row<0 || col<0) then there was no active cell in the sheet.

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_set_active_cell ()
refsect2.para: Set active cell where the cell entry will be displayed. Use (row,col) = (-1,-1) to deactivate active cell.

listitem.simpara: FALSE if current cell can't be deactivated or requested cell can't be activated

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_set_tab_direction ()
refsect2.para:
Sets a primary movement direction to the Tab, Return and Enter keys, and assigns the opposite direction to the same keys with GDK_SHIFT_MASK.
Transposed movement direction can be accessed with GTK_SHEET_MOD_MASK|GDK_CONTROL_MASK and GTK_SHEET_MOD_MASK|GDK_CONTROL_MASK|GDK_SHIFT_MASK.
All bindings are defined for the GtkSheetClass, so all sheet instances use the same movement directions.
Default: GTK_DIR_TAB_FORWARD.
Since 3.0.2

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_get_selection ()
refsect2.para: Inquire current cell selection state and range.

listitem.simpara: where to store the GtkSheetState, may be NULL
TRUE: there is a selection, FALSE: no selection or error

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_select_row ()
refsect2.para: Select the row. The range is then highlighted, and the bounds are stored in sheet->range.

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_select_range ()
refsect2.para: Highlight the selected range and store bounds in sheet->range

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_unselect_range ()
refsect2.para: Unselect the current selected range and clears the bounds in sheet->range.

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_get_tooltip_markup ()
refsect2.para: Gets the contents of the tooltip (markup) for sheet

listitem.simpara: the tooltip text, or NULL. You should free the returned string with g_free() when done.

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_set_tooltip_markup ()
refsect2.para: Sets markup as the contents of the tooltip, which is marked up with the Pango text markup language.

listitem.simpara: the contents of the tooltip for widget, or NULL.

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_get_tooltip_text ()
refsect2.para: Gets the contents of the tooltip for the GtkSheet

listitem.simpara: the tooltip text, or NULL. You should free the returned string with g_free() when done.

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_set_tooltip_text ()
refsect2.para: Sets text as the contents of the tooltip.

listitem.simpara: the contents of the tooltip for widget

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_add_row ()
refsect2.para: Append nrows rows to the end of the sheet.

listitem.simpara: number of rows to be appended.

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_insert_rows ()
refsect2.para: Insert nrows rows before the given row and pull right.

listitem.simpara: number of rows to be inserted.

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_delete_rows ()
refsect2.para: Delete nrows rows starting from row.

listitem.simpara: number of rows to be deleted.

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_row_titles_visible ()
refsect2.para: Get the visibility of row column titles .

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_show_row_titles ()
refsect2.para: Show row titles .

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_hide_row_titles ()
refsect2.para: Hide row titles .

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_get_row_title ()
refsect2.para: Get row title.

listitem.simpara: a pointer to the row title or NULL. Do not modify or free it.

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_set_row_title ()
refsect2.para: Set row title.

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_set_row_titles_width ()
refsect2.para: Resize row titles area.

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_set_row_height ()
refsect2.para: Set row height.

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_row_button_get_label ()
refsect2.para: Get a row button label.

listitem.simpara: In case of succes , a pointer to label text.Otherwise NULL

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_row_button_add_label ()
refsect2.para: Set button label.It is used to set a row title.

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_row_button_justify ()
refsect2.para: Set the justification(alignment) of the row buttons.

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_row_sensitive ()
refsect2.para: Get row button sensitivity.

listitem.simpara: TRUE - is sensitive, FALSE - insensitive or not existant

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_row_set_sensitivity ()
refsect2.para: Set row button sensitivity. If sensitivity is TRUE can be toggled, otherwise it acts as a title .

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_rows_set_sensitivity ()
refsect2.para: Set rows buttons sensitivity. If sensitivity is TRUE button can be toggled, otherwise act as titles. The sheet itself has no such property, it is a convenience function to set the property for all existing rows.

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_rows_resizable ()
refsect2.para: Get rows resizable status.

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_rows_set_resizable ()
refsect2.para: Set rows resizable status.

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_row_visible ()
refsect2.para: Get row visibility.

listitem.simpara: TRUE - is visible FALSE - invisible or not existant

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_row_set_visibility ()
refsect2.para: Set row visibility. The default value is TRUE. If FALSE, the row is hidden.

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_row_label_set_visibility ()
refsect2.para: Set row label visibility.

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_rows_labels_set_visibility ()
refsect2.para: Set all rows label visibility. The sheet itself has no such property, this is a convenience function to set the property for all existing rows.

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_row_get_tooltip_markup ()
refsect2.para: Gets the contents of the tooltip (markup) for the column

listitem.simpara: the tooltip text, or NULL. You should free the returned string with g_free() when done.

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_row_set_tooltip_markup ()
refsect2.para: Sets markup as the contents of the tooltip, which is marked up with the Pango text markup language.

listitem.simpara: the contents of the tooltip for widget, or NULL.

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_row_get_tooltip_text ()
refsect2.para: Gets the contents of the tooltip for the column

listitem.simpara: the tooltip text, or NULL. You should free the returned string with g_free() when done.

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_row_set_tooltip_text ()
refsect2.para: Sets text as the contents of the tooltip.

listitem.simpara: the contents of the tooltip for widget

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_set_cell ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_sheet_set_cell (GtkSheet *sheet, gint row, gint col, GtkJustification justification, const gchar *text);
refsect2.para: Set cell contents and allocate memory if needed.

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_set_cell_text ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_sheet_set_cell_text (GtkSheet *sheet, gint row, gint col, const gchar *text);
refsect2.para: Set cell contents and allocate memory if needed. No justifcation is made. attributes and links remain unchanged.

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_cell_get_text ()
refsect2.para: Get cell text.

listitem.simpara: a pointer to the cell text, or NULL. Do not modify or free it.

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_cell_clear ()
refsect2.para: Clear cell contents.

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_cell_delete ()
refsect2.para: Clear cell contents and remove links.

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_cell_get_state ()
refsect2.para: Get status of a cell.

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_cell_get_tooltip_markup ()
refsect2.para: Gets the contents of the tooltip (markup) for the column

listitem.simpara: the tooltip text, or NULL. You should free the returned string with g_free() when done.

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_cell_set_tooltip_markup ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_sheet_cell_set_tooltip_markup (GtkSheet *sheet, const gint row, const gint col, const gchar *markup);
refsect2.para: Sets markup as the contents of the tooltip, which is marked up with the Pango text markup language.

listitem.simpara: the contents of the tooltip for widget, or NULL.

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_cell_get_tooltip_text ()
refsect2.para: Gets the contents of the tooltip for the column

listitem.simpara: the tooltip text, or NULL. You should free the returned string with g_free() when done.

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_cell_set_tooltip_text ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_sheet_cell_set_tooltip_text (GtkSheet *sheet, const gint row, const gint col, const gchar *text);
refsect2.para: Sets text as the contents of the tooltip.

listitem.simpara: the contents of the tooltip for widget

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_get_cell_area ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean gtk_sheet_get_cell_area (GtkSheet *sheet, gint row, gint column, GdkRectangle *area);
refsect2.para: Get area of a given cell.

listitem.simpara: a GdkRectangle area of the cell

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_get_pixel_info ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean gtk_sheet_get_pixel_info (GtkSheet *sheet, GdkWindow *window, gint x, gint y, gint *row, gint *column);
refsect2.para:
Get row and column correspondig to the given position within the sheet.
In order to decode clicks into to title area correctly, pass the GdkWindow from the button event. Omitting the window (NULL) defaults to the sheet window.
row and column may return values in the range [-1 .. max+1] depending on wether the position lies within the title area, the sheet cell area or beyond the outermost row/column.
All 9 sheet areas can be reliably determined by evaluating the returned row/column values (title area/cell area/outside).

listitem.simpara: TRUE if the position lies within the sheet cell area or FALSE when outside (title area f.e.)

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_get_link ()
refsect2.para: Get link pointer from a cell.

listitem.simpara: (transfer none) pointer linked to the cell

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_link_cell ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_sheet_link_cell (GtkSheet *sheet, gint row, gint col, gpointer link);
refsect2.para: Link pointer to a cell.

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_remove_link ()
refsect2.para: Remove link pointer from a cell.

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_range_clear ()
refsect2.para: Clear range contents. If range==NULL the whole sheet will be cleared.

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_range_delete ()
refsect2.para: Clear range contents and remove links. FIXME:: if range==NULL whole sheet is deleted?

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_range_set_background ()
refsect2.para: Set background color of the given range.

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_range_set_foreground ()
refsect2.para: Set foreground color of the given range.

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_range_set_justification ()
refsect2.para: Set text justification (GTK_JUSTIFY_LEFT, RIGHT, CENTER) of the given range. The default value is GTK_JUSTIFY_LEFT. If autoformat is on, the default justification for numbers is GTK_JUSTIFY_RIGHT.

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_range_set_editable ()
refsect2.para: Set if cell contents can be edited or not in the given range.

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_range_set_visible ()
refsect2.para: Set if cell contents are visible or not in the given range: accepted values are TRUE or FALSE.

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_range_set_border ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_sheet_range_set_border (GtkSheet *sheet, const GtkSheetRange *urange, gint mask, guint width, gint line_style);
refsect2.para: Set cell border style in the given range.

listitem.simpara: a GtkSheetRange where we set border style.
width of the border line in pixels

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_range_set_border_color ()
refsect2.para: Set border color for the given range.

listitem.simpara: a GtkSheetRange where we set border color.

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_range_set_font ()
refsect2.para: Set font_desc for the given range.

listitem.simpara: a GtkSheetRange where we set font_desc.

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_put ()
refsect2.programlisting: GtkSheetChild * gtk_sheet_put (GtkSheet *sheet, GtkWidget *child, gint x, gint y);
refsect2.para: Add widgets to the sheet. The widget is floating in one given position (x,y) regardless of the configurations of rows/columns. This means that cells do not resize depending on the widgets' size. You can resize it yourself or use gtk_sheet_attach_*() You may remove it with gtk_container_remove(GTK_CONTAINER(sheet), GtkWidget *child);

listitem.simpara: x coordinate where we put the widget
y coordinate where we put the widget
(transfer none) TRUE means that the cell is currently allocated.

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_attach ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_sheet_attach (GtkSheet *sheet, GtkWidget *widget, gint row, gint col, gint xoptions, gint yoptions, gint xpadding, gint ypadding);
refsect2.para: Attaches a child widget to the given cell with the given alignments. Works basically like gtk_table_attach, with the same options, the widget is confined in the cell, and whether it fills the cell, expands with it, or shrinks with it, depending on the options , if GTK_EXPAND is set. The child is reallocated each time the column or row changes, keeping attached to the same cell.

listitem.simpara: if set GTK_EXPAND cell will expand/shrink on x direction
if set GTK_EXPAND cell will expand/shrink on y direction

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_attach_floating ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_sheet_attach_floating (GtkSheet *sheet, GtkWidget *widget, gint row, gint col);
refsect2.para: The widget is attached to the top-left corner of a cell (row,column) and moves with it when you change width, height, or you delete of add row/columns

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_attach_default ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_sheet_attach_default (GtkSheet *sheet, GtkWidget *widget, gint row, gint col);
refsect2.para: Attaches a child widget to the given cell with the 0,0 alignments. Works basically like gtk_table_attach, with the same options, the widget is confined in the cell, and whether it fills the cell, expands with it, or shrinks with it, depending on the options. The child is reallocated each time the column or row changes, keeping attached to the same cell. It's in fact gtk_sheet_attach() with GTK_EXPAND set.

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_move_child ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_sheet_move_child (GtkSheet *sheet, GtkWidget *widget, gint x, gint y);
refsect2.para: Move widgets added with gtk_sheet_put() in the sheet.

listitem.simpara: x coord at which we move the widget.
y coord at which we move the widget.

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_get_child_at ()
refsect2.para: Get the child attached at row,col.

listitem.simpara: the GtkSheetChild attached to row,col or NULL

refsect2.title: gtk_sheet_button_attach ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_sheet_button_attach (GtkSheet *sheet, GtkWidget *widget, gint row, gint col);
refsect2.para: Button attach works like cell attach but for the buttons.

refsect2.title: The "autoresize" property
refsect2.para: Autoreisize cells while typing (rows and columns)
Default value: FALSE

refsect2.title: The "autoresize-cols" property
refsect2.para: Autoreisize columns while typing
Default value: FALSE

refsect2.title: The "autoresize-rows" property
refsect2.para: Autoreisize rows while typing
Default value: FALSE

refsect2.title: The "autoscroll" property
refsect2.para: The sheet will be automatically scrolled when you move beyond the last visible row/column
Default value: TRUE

refsect2.title: The "bgcolor" property
refsect2.para: Background color of the sheet

refsect2.title: The "clip-text" property
refsect2.para: Clip text in cells
Default value: FALSE

refsect2.title: The "col-titles-height" property
refsect2.para: Height of the column titles
Allowed values: <= 1024
Default value: 24

refsect2.title: The "col-titles-visible" property
refsect2.para: Visibility of the column titles
Default value: TRUE

refsect2.title: The "columns-resizable" property
refsect2.para: Columns resizable
Default value: TRUE

refsect2.title: The "description" property
refsect2.para: The sheets description, a place to store further information for application use
Default value: ""

refsect2.title: The "entry-type" property
refsect2.para: Sheet cell entry widget type
Default value: GTK_SHEET_ENTRY_TYPE_DEFAULT

refsect2.title: The "grid-color" property
refsect2.para: Color of the grid

refsect2.title: The "grid-visible" property
refsect2.para: Sets the visibility of grid
Default value: TRUE

refsect2.title: The "justify-entry" property
refsect2.para: Adapt cell entry editor to the cell justification.
Default value: TRUE

refsect2.title: The "locked" property
refsect2.para: If the sheet ist locked, it is not editable, cell contents cannot be modified by the user.
Default value: FALSE

refsect2.title: The "n-rows" property
refsect2.para: Number of rows in the sheet
Allowed values: [0,1000000]
Default value: 0

refsect2.title: The "row-titles-visible" property
refsect2.para: Row titles visible
Default value: TRUE

refsect2.title: The "row-titles-width" property
refsect2.para: Width of the row title area
Allowed values: <= 2048
Default value: 80

refsect2.title: The "rows-resizable" property
refsect2.para: Rows resizable
Default value: TRUE

refsect2.title: The "selection-mode" property
refsect2.para: Sets the selection mode of the cells in a GtkSheet
Default value: GTK_SELECTION_BROWSE

refsect2.title: The "title" property
refsect2.para: The sheets title string
Default value: "GtkSheet"

refsect2.title: The "vjust" property
refsect2.para: Default vertical cell text justification
Default value: GTK_SHEET_VERTICAL_JUSTIFICATION_TOP

refsect2.title: The "activate" signal
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean user_function (GtkSheet *sheet, gint row, gint column, gpointer user_data) : Run Last
refsect2.para: Emmited whenever a cell is activated(you click on it). FIXME:: The return value is ignored (not yet implemented).

listitem.simpara: the sheet widget that emitted the signal
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The "changed" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GtkSheet *sheet, gint row, gint column, gpointer user_data) : Run Last
refsect2.para: "Emited when typing into the active cell, changing its content. It is emitted after each key press in cell and after deactivating cell.

listitem.simpara: the sheet widget that emitted the signal
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The "clear-cell" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GtkSheet *sheet, gint row, gint column, gpointer user_data) : Run Last
refsect2.para: Emited when when the content of the cell is erased.

listitem.simpara: the sheet widget that emitted the signal
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The "clip-range" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GtkSheet *sheet, GtkSheetRange *clip_range, gpointer user_data) : Run Last
refsect2.para: Emmited when a GtkSheetRange is clipping.

listitem.simpara: the sheet widget that emitted the signal
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The "deactivate" signal
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean user_function (GtkSheet *sheet, gint row, gint column, gpointer user_data) : Run Last
refsect2.para:
Emmited whenever a cell is deactivated(you click on other cell or start a new selection).
The signal handler must return TRUE in order to allow deactivation, FALSE to deny deactivation.

listitem.simpara: the sheet widget that emitted the signal
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The "enter-pressed" signal
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean user_function (GtkSheet *sheet, GdkEvent *event, gpointer user_data) : Run Last
refsect2.para:
This signal intercepts RETURN and ENTER key-press-events before they are processed by the sheet-entry editor. Any modifier combinations on these keys may trigger the signal.
The default behaviour of the sheet-entry editor is to move the active cell, which might not be appropriate for the type of application.

listitem.simpara: the sheet widget that emitted the signal
the GdkEventKey which triggered this signal.. type Gdk.EventKey.
user data set when the signal handler was connected.
TRUE to block the sheet-entry from processing the event. FALSE to propagate the event to the sheet-entry.

refsect2.title: The "entry-focus-in" signal
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean user_function (GtkSheet *sheet, GdkEvent *event, gpointer user_data) : Run Last
refsect2.para: The ::entry-focus-in signal will be emitted when the keyboard focus enters the sheet_entry editor.

listitem.simpara: the sheet widget that emitted the signal
the GdkEventFocus which triggered this signal
user data set when the signal handler was connected.
TRUE to stop other handlers from being invoked for the event. FALSE to propagate the event further.

refsect2.para: Since 3.0.1

refsect2.title: The "entry-focus-out" signal
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean user_function (GtkSheet *sheet, GdkEvent *event, gpointer user_data) : Run Last
refsect2.para: The ::entry-focus-out signal will be emitted when the keyboard focus leaves the sheet_entry editor.

listitem.simpara: the sheet widget that emitted the signal
the GdkEventFocus which triggered this signal
user data set when the signal handler was connected.
TRUE to stop other handlers from being invoked for the event. FALSE to propagate the event further.

refsect2.para: Since 3.0.1

refsect2.title: The "move-cursor" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GtkSheet *sheet, GtkMovementStep step, gint count, gboolean extend_selection, gpointer user_data) : Run Last / Action
refsect2.para:
The ::move-cursor signal is a keybinding signal which gets emitted when the user initiates a cursor movement.
Applications should not connect to it, but may emit it with g_signal_emit_by_name() if they need to control the cursor programmatically.

listitem.simpara: the sheet widget that emitted the signal
the granularity of the move, as a GtkMovementStep
the number of step units to move
TRUE if the move should extend the selection
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.para: Since 3.0.2

refsect2.title: The "move-range" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GtkSheet *sheet, GtkSheetRange *old_range, GtkSheetRange *new_range, gpointer user_data) : Run Last
refsect2.para: Emmited when a GtkSheetRange is moved.

listitem.simpara: the sheet widget that emitted the signal.
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The "new-column-width" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GtkSheet *sheet, gint col, gint width, gpointer user_data) : Run Last
refsect2.para: Emited when the width of a column is modified.

listitem.simpara: the sheet widget that emitted the signal
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The "new-row-height" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GtkSheet *sheet, gint row, gint height, gpointer user_data) : Run Last
refsect2.para: Emited when the height of a row is modified.

listitem.simpara: the sheet widget that emitted the signal
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The "populate-popup" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GtkSheet *sheet, GtkMenu *menu, gpointer user_data) : Run Last
refsect2.para:
The ::populate-popup signal will be emitted when the user activates the popup menu of the sheet_entry editor.
The emission of this signal is only supported for GtkEntry, GtkDataEntry, GtkItemEntry and GtkTextView.

listitem.simpara: the sheet widget that emitted the signal
the menu that ist being populated
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.para: Since 3.0.1

refsect2.title: The "resize-range" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GtkSheet *sheet, GtkSheetRange *old_range, GtkSheetRange *new_range, gpointer user_data) : Run Last
refsect2.para: Emmited when a GtkSheetRange is resized.

listitem.simpara: the sheet widget that emitted the signal
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The "select-column" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GtkSheet *sheet, gint select_column, gpointer user_data) : Run Last
refsect2.para: Emmited when a column has been selected.

listitem.simpara: the sheet widget that emitted the signal
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The "select-range" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GtkSheet *sheet, GtkSheetRange *select_range, gpointer user_data) : Run Last
refsect2.para: Emmited when a GtkSheetRange has been selected.

listitem.simpara: the sheet widget that emitted the signal
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The "select-row" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GtkSheet *sheet, gint row, gpointer user_data) : Run Last
refsect2.para: Emmited when a row has been selected.

listitem.simpara: the sheet widget that emitted the signal
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The "set-cell" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GtkSheet *sheet, gint row, gint column, gpointer user_data) : Run Last
refsect2.para: Emited when clicking on a non-empty cell.

listitem.simpara: the sheet widget that emitted the signal
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The "set-scroll-adjustments" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GtkSheet *sheet, GtkAdjustment *hadjustment, GtkAdjustment *vadjustment, gpointer user_data) : Run Last
refsect2.para: Emited when scroll adjustments are set.

listitem.simpara: the sheet widget that emitted the signal
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The "traverse" signal
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean user_function (GtkSheet *sheet, gint row, gint column, gpointer *new_row, gpointer *new_column, gpointer user_data) : Run Last
refsect2.para:
The "traverse" is emited before "deactivate" and allows to veto the movement. In such case, the entry will remain in the site and the other signals will not be emited.
The signal handler must return TRUE to allow the movement, FALSE to veto the movement.

listitem.simpara: the sheet widget that emitted the signal.
row number of target cell, changeable
column number of target cell, changeable
user data set when the signal handler was connected.
